intro: Oxydectes nobilis, commonly known as the noble oxeye, is a flowering plant native to parts of Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features showy yellow ray florets surrounding a central disk of smaller, tubular flowers. It typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. Oxydectes nobilis is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is also used in traditional medicine.
